summary: The Recycling Infrastructure and Accessibility Act of 2025 establishes a pilot grant program within the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) to improve recycling accessibility. The program will award grants to states, local governments, Indian Tribes, and public-private partnerships to enhance recycling infrastructure, particularly in underserved communities. Grants can be used for projects like increasing transfer stations, expanding curbside recycling programs, and leveraging public-private partnerships. The bill authorizes appropriations of $30 million annually from 2025 to 2029.
